sentence.Network_cn: 他的话犹如一枚重磅炸弹。他告诉我他要死了。

entry.tran: 意外的坏消息；出乎意料的消息
entry.def: A bombshell is a sudden piece of bad or unexpected news.

example.ex: His resignation after thirteen years is a political bombshell...
example.tran: 他任职13年后提出辞职，这在政治上轰动一时。

example.ex: The police told me. It was a bombshell. I had no idea.
example.tran: 是警察告诉我的。我很震惊，完全没想到。

means.word_mean: 1. an entertainer who has a sensational effect;

sentences.sentence: "news of the attack came like a bombshell"

means.word_mean: 3. an explosive bomb or artillery shell

means.word_mean: 爆炸性事件,令人吃惊的事

sentences.en: Then she dropped her bombshell.“I’m pregnant.
sentences.cn: ”然后她说出了令人震惊的事,“我怀孕了。”

sentences.en: The news came as a bombshell.
It was then that he dropped the bombshell—he wasn’t planning to come with us.
sentences.cn: 那时他突然宣布一个令人不快的消息,他不准备跟我们一起去了。
